channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Israel and Hamas trade jabs over Gaza ceasefire proposal
item.description: A US-backed Israeli proposal for a ceasefire deal appears to be in limbo, with neither side yet publicly committing to the plan as talks continue. Hamas proposed changes to the deal while Israel is yet to formally endorse its own plan. Follow for live updates.

item.title: Thefts of charging cables pose yet another obstacle to appeal of electric vehicles
item.description: Across the U.S., thieves have been targeting electric-vehicle charging stations, intent on stealing the cables, which contain copper wiring

item.title: In Asheville, a land-use YouTuber makes waves advocating for more housing, safer roads
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: Video emerges after 4 women, 2 children killed at home in Mexico
item.description: The murders occurred in an industrial city in the state of Guanajuato â€‹where drug cartels have been fighting bloody turf battles for years.

item.title: Hunter Biden found guilty on all counts in gun case
item.description: A federal jury found Hunter Biden guilty Tuesday on all three federal felony gun charges he faced.

item.title: 1 dead after bus hijacked at gunpoint in Georgia; suspect in custody: Police
item.description: One person was fatally shot in connection with a bus hijacking that spanned several counties in Georgia on Tuesday, authorities said.

item.title: Sen. Lindsey Graham says he will block Democrats' effort to unanimously pass Supreme Court ethics bill
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: Hunter Biden's options for appeal after gun conviction
item.description: Hunter Biden's potential appeal of his gun conviction might reference one of these constitutional arguments.

item.title: As Equals: Frequently Asked Questions
item.description: Find out more about As Equals, CNN's gender inequality series, and how you can get in touch with the team.

item.title: Malawi announces 21 days of mourning for vice president killed in a plane crash
item.description: The Malawi government says that Vice President Saulos Chilima will be honored with a state funeral after he was killed along with eight other people in a plane crash

item.title: Las Vegas driver allegedly googled crash in hours after fatal hit-and-run, drove to Pahrump for repairs
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: House to vote on holding Merrick Garland in contempt over Biden audio
item.description: Republicans want audio recordings of special counsel Robert Hur's interview with President Biden and his ghostwriter.

item.title: June 10, 2024 Israel-Hamas war
item.description: The UN Security Council adopted a resolution proposed by the United States for a permanent ceasefire and release of the hostages in Gaza.

item.title: DOT estimates at least $1.7 billion to rebuild Baltimore bridge
item.description: The preliminary costs to rebuild the bridge as quoted by the DOT are between $1.7 billion and $1.9 billion, officials said.

item.title: Tesla shareholder sues Musk to return billions in alleged unlawful profits
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: Skier's body recovered at Mount Rainier 3 weeks after apparent 200-foot fall
item.description: The body of a female skier last heard from on May 18 was recovered in Mount Rainier National Park three weeks later, officials said. She'd apparently fallen about 200 feet.

item.title: Apple introduces AI to its products at WWDC
item.description: Apple introduced "Apple Intelligence" -- a suite of artificial intelligence tools -- to its products at its annual Worldwide Developers Conference (WWDC) on Monday, while announcing a host of Apple product updates.

item.title: At least 41 die in a fire at a building housing workers in Kuwait
item.description: At least 41 people have died when a fire swept through a building that housed workers in Kuwait

item.title: U.S. deploys warships as Russian fleet makes close pass to Florida in approach to Cuba
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: Xsolla: 20 Years of Expertise in Video Game Innovation
item.description: Founded in 2005, Xsolla is a global video game commerce company headquartered in Los Angeles. With almost 20 years of expertise, Xsolla provides a comprehensive suite of tools and services, enabling partners to fund, market, sell, and monetize their games worldwide.
